newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore rubber down on Japan and light selling.
newsitem.headline: Singapore rubber down on Japan and light selling.

text.p: Rubber futures finished lower across the board on Wednesday in light trade on the back of lower Japanese prices and a bout of mild selling in the market, dealers said.
"Prices fell in line with weak Japanese prices and some selling in the local market. But the volumes done were small and the market may go back into a sleepy mode tomorrow," one trader said.
Tokyo's newly listed benchmark March contract closed at 136.5 yen after opening at 138.8 while Kobe's March contract closed at 136.3 yen after likewise opening at 139.2.
"The market is still basically bearish and prices are still in the process of looking for its bottom," another trader said.
At around 0945 GMT, November RSS3 was seen at 124.00-126.00 U.S. cents a kg from 126.50 cents.
November RSS1 was seen at 178.00-180.00 Singapore cents (US$1.25-$1.27) a kg from Tuesday's settlement of 181.50 cents.
November TSR20 was quoted at 174.00-176.00 Singapore cents (US$1.23-$1.24) a kg against the previous 176.75 cents.
